result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Manuel Hernandez

defendant.name: Hernandez, Luis Manuel
defendant.address: 2812 E Bolivar Ave,8, St Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Luis Manuel Hernandez.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call.  Court withdrew stayed warrant.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in Court for Status Conference. Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled this hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ashley F.

Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: St Francis Detective Z Gilden. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Court ordered an oral no contact order with MAD, HRS, AAF, NG.  State to submitt written no contact order by the next order.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Defendant Luis Manuel Hernandez in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
